Reason: The internode_tcp_connect_timeout_in_ms configuration in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can have a significant impact on the overall system performance. This configuration determines the timeout for establishing TCP connections between nodes in a Cassandra cluster. A lower timeout value can lead to faster connection establishment but may also increase the likelihood of connection failures, while a higher timeout value can reduce connection failures but may result in longer wait times. Therefore, any change in this configuration can directly affect the system's communication efficiency and overall performance.
